meanings.definition: A genre of music that parodies popular songs with humorous or satirical lyrics.
meanings.sent1: At the convention, they sang a filk that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: The filk they performed at the talent show was a big hit.
meanings.sent3: The filk about aliens taking over the world was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her filk about office life was a clever twist on a popular tune.
meanings.sent5: The filk about cats and dogs was so catchy, it stayed in my head all day.

meanings.definition: To write or perform filk music.
meanings.sent1: She loves to filk her favorite songs with funny lyrics.
meanings.sent2: They decided to filk a famous tune for the talent show.
meanings.sent3: He filks whenever he's feeling creative and inspired.
meanings.sent4: The band will filk a classic rock song at the concert.
meanings.sent5: Families gathered around the campfire to filk together under the stars.

meanings.sent1: They played a catchy filk during the music festival.
meanings.sent2: The radio station played a new filk that became popular quickly.
meanings.sent3: The filk they wrote for the school play was a big hit.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite filk is about superheroes saving the day.
meanings.sent5: The filk they sang at the party had everyone dancing and singing along.
